intro: Psychotria meridianomontana, commonly known as the Andean Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes, particularly in countries like Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
